intro: Polyphragmon flavescens, commonly known as the yellow-flowered phragmon, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant features showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. Polyphragmon flavescens is often found in grasslands and rocky outcrops, thriving in well-drained soils.
